column2:
acctg 1 prof: okay let's prepare entries. pick 2 companies. Uh, let's have san miguel and philip morris.
class: *giggles*
prof: eh bakit tatawa-tawa kayo dyan? eh lasengga at chain smoker ako eh, bakit ba?

math prof: ang sakit ng likod ko ngayon. nagtraining na kasi kami ng partner ko for the badminton doubles para sa cs cup (yata). Defending champions kami and we have to protect the crown. Alam niyo ba kung ano ginagawa ko? taga-yuko ako at taga-ilag sa shuttle cock kaya iyan, masakit nga likod ko. tinatantsa ko pa yun ah. yung partner ko naman, ang galing galing talaga!
san ung TBA? =P

freshman: manong, sa UP po.
tricyle driver: ay, iskwater! yuckk!!!!! 

lol

isang matyagang labmate na nahihirapan sa pagpoprogram ng para sa isang CS subject:
"kung pagmamahal nga natututunan, eto pa kaya..."

Dr. Lazaro: (To me, arriving ten minutes late for his radio class) Why are you late? Akala mo ganun kaganda report mo? Sige tingnan natin, kung palpak yan, boljak ang abot mo!

(Pero truly, I love him. :))

First day ng Span 10 class.
May Chinese guy kasi na late dumating tas dirediretso lang siya pumasok sa classroom without greeting the prof. Nainis tuloy si sir.
Sir: Blahblahblah. San ka grumaduate ng high school? Xavier ba?
Guy: Di po. Ateneo po. (Nalaman ko nalang after a few days na from Xavier nga siya.:)))
Sir: *Inirapan si Chinese guy sabay tuloy na sa pinaguusapan ulit.*
Nung patapos na ung class... (Ewan ko kung bakit napunta ung usapan dito..)
Sir: Ayaw ko talaga sa mga Chinese. Blahblahblah. *Sabay tingin kay Chinese guy.*

Sobrang natawa lang kaming mga classmates koooo! :))

first day as a freshie, naghahanap kami ng upuan ng classmate ko. may nakita kaming mga upuan sa tapat ng casaa. so umupo kami. tinanong kami kung freshies kami. sabi namin oo. tapos nalaman na lang namin na tambayan pala ng praxis un :)) nakakahiya :))

Math 11:

Prof - "Pano nyo ba i-spell ang "duh"?
Kami - "D-U-H"
Prof - "Buti alam nyo... may nakita ako sa test paper: DA!"

*kulang na lang, la-sag-na, heheh*

May nakasabay akong dalawang matandang babae sa ikot jeep, ang tema ng usapan nila ay ganito:

Lola 1: "parang tatlong beses na natin nadaan ito" ( sa may Public Ad)

Lola 2: "sabi ko sa iyo sabihin mo ibaba tayo sa terminal eh"

Ako (thought bubble): Naku, mga lola iikot lang po ng iikot itong jeep na ito, aabutin kayo ng siyam siyam kakaantay sa terminal.
Prof : ONLY GOD DESERVES 1. and I am GOD!

PI100 Prof:

Class, tignan nyo si Rizal. Ang batang namatay (35 years old) pero ang dami dami na nyang nasulat. Pano pa kung umabot sya ng 40 o 50 years old no? Buti nalang. Kundi ang dami pa nating aaralin. Buti na at namatay sya ng maaga!

Fil40 class of Maam April Perez
After watching an indie film with gay love scenes

Freshie classmate: Oh no. Childhood innocence ko, wala na.
Older classmate: Kung ayaw mo ng ganyan, take Soc Sci 3.
Freshie classmate: Talaga kuya? Sige i-eenlist ko next sem.
[Evil tong kuya na to. Hahaha.]

Gay Classmate during PE Class tries his best to imitate Tyra Banks' 'fierce eyes'.

PROF: Pwedeng, ano, look at your partner with lust, hindi parang papatayin mo. This is Rhumba. Not Halloween.
Girl while reviewing Math 17 sa toki, iaabot ang bayad sa driver habang nakatingin sa notes: "MANONG X-squared" :))

One day while eating Fried Siomai sa Fine Arts, I was with Mimi Lucas and we were seating sa newly made shed near Ate Siomai... :)

Cla: Ui o, yung babae, kita na yung panty niya hanggang dun sa half ng butt cheek.
Mimi: Anong gagawin ko?
Cla: Sabihin mo sa kanya. :|

Mimi: Ms, Ms, yung panty niyo po kitang-kita na..
Ms: (no reaction) *Sabay baba ng shirt. :|*

Hindi niya tinaas yung leggings niya eh, instead, binaba niya yung shirt :|
'You cannot break free from the past totally.' (MN, Math 55)

di ko alam kung luma na ito or bago pero share ko na lang-- a joke from my Acctg1 classmate (gosh, kakalabas lang ng result ng 2nd exam kanina ni ma'am debbie):

Q: ano ang difference ng Counting sa Accounting?

S: ang counting ay one.... two.... threee....




ang accounting ay a-wan.... a-tu.... a-tree... :D

THIRD YEAR na Orgmate ko:

Nakalagay sa Form 5 niya, venue ng PE niya V. Rooftop. Ayan si kuya, atat, ten minutes before 4 PM nandun na sa Vinzon's Rooftop. Tapos parang thirty minutes na, walang tao at nakalock yung door. Iiyak na si kuya, nagtatanong na sa Office ng Collegian kung may notice ba yung prof na magcacancel ng class.

Buti na lang tinawagan niya yung Sports Sci naming orgmate at saka niya lang nalaman na may iba pa palang V. Rooftop - Vanguard. Isipin mo, mag-PE ka sa Vinzon's Rooftop!

Pan Pil 19 Class, yung ibang group ng classmates ko ay nagrereport about sex toys. Yung iba, nagdala ng mga nabili/nahiram na sex toys. Then, this one classmate of mine, Audri Belo, brought out from her bag a snorkel. Parang walang nag-react nung linabas niya, so after class, I texted her.

Me: Bakit pala may dala kang snorkel kanina? :)

Audri: Wala kasi akong nakuhang totoong sex toy eh, so nagdala na lang ako ng kamukha ng ano. :))

Me: ??

Audri: Hindi ba para naman siyang ano?

Me: AHAHAHAHAHAHAHA! XD

FAIL! (Sorry, Dree!!! Peace!!!) :))

Nung first Physics 71.1 day, di ko sure san yung classroom ko. unang kong pinuntahan yung Llamas hall, tapos sabi sakin nung guard dun dapat ako sa new NIP (yung malapit sa math). Sabi nya, lagpasan ko raw yung math, tapos kaliwa tapos straight na yun.

nung bago ako makarating ng math, naalala ko yung lesson about Hypotenuse. haha shortest distance diba? so tinahak ko yung pinapatag na lupa dun (2 yrs ago na ito, nung ginagawa yung new oval)

i ended up passing thru a creek... tapos nasa kalagitnaan na ako ng matataas na talahib. sobrang grabeng adventure yun para makarating sa (new) NIP.

The next day, may mga emails na nagkalat about the japanese landmines found in that area. hahaha buti wala pala akong natapakan!
Dumadami na ang members! Dapat mas marami members natin kesa dun sa kabila. Wahaha. (Competitive??). MASS INVITATION! XD
karatula ng isang studyanteng pro-choice sa isang pro-life assembly: IF YOU ARE AGAINST ABORTION, DON'T EAT BALOT!

PROF (after calling attendance): Okay, guys let's start!
FAT CLASSMATE: Sir, you haven't called my name yet.
PROF: Oo na, minark na kita as present. You're hard not to miss you know.

PROF (at CLASSMATE who wants to shift): Oh, maliban sa iyong video making skills ano naman ba ang macocontribute mo sa department?
GAY CLASSMATE (thinking fast, points at face and at body): Sir, am I not enough?
PROF: Ay, wow. Pakiulit.
GAY CLASSMATE: Am I not enough?

Prof laughs for about three minutes. Then throws an eraser at him. (Pajoke lang naman at in fairness hindi naman siya tatama.)

Classmate: Alam mo ba pinakamahirap daw na course ang BLIS..
Ako: Talaga? (smile) Bakit naman daw?
Classmate: e kasi ang daming prerequisites..
Ako: Parang ang konti lang naman kaya..
Classmate: Kailangan mo po magMath17, Chem16 at kung anu anong 5units pa..saka kailangan mo ding magEng'g bago mo matapos ang course..

ok..hahaha

How many Ateneans does it take to change a lightbulb?
Answer: One. he just sticks it in the socket and the whole world revolves around him!

Overheard at UP College of Law:

Student1: May Overheard at Ateneo. May Narinig sa UP. Eh bakit yung La Salle walang Overheard sa Facebook?

Student2: Kasi wala ka talagang maririnig sa mga taga-La Salle na worth gawan ng Facebook group.

Dr. Someone: Hijo, please buy me a cup of pineapple juice from the tea room. Bumababa ang blood sugar level ko sa class nyo.
[Parang gusto kong sabihin, "Maam, apologies for being sabaw." Haha.]

Ang uno ay parang infinity over infinity, it does not exist. :)

Nagdidiscuss si ma'am tungkol sa Vaporization.

Habang nagdidiscuss, pinabasa sa akin yung isang slide sa powerpoint. Then yung isa namang kaklase ko...

Classmate: ...is the reverse of Heat of ...

ba, bapo, bapori, bapo...

BAPORIZATION. Blah blah.

(sorry nag-sspam ako. cinocopy paste ko lang to galing sa blog ko)

PROF : O, ikaw naman Noy. Mas gwapo ka ba sa tatay mo?
CLASSMATE : Hindi po.
PROF : Anong klase yan? You're supposed to improve. Ulitin natin. Noy, mas gwapo ka ba sa tatay mo?
CLASSMATE : Opo.
PROF : My god, what does your father look like

PROF : O, so what do you think of this story?
CLASS : Sir, I think it shows that the old man loved the girl.
GAY CLASSMATE : Sir, on the contrary I disagree. I believe that it was not love but the thought of it.
PROF : E, di ba you're gay? And gays hate women. Maybe you're just projecting yourself. Hindi kaya?

Prof (at gay classmate): Oh, bat ka naman absent these past few days?
Classmate: Sir, I was sick!
Prof: Sick? Ang bata-bata mo pa, may AIDS ka na!

Kanina lang sa class ko sa Comm 130. Ang topic ay operationalization:

Sir: So how do you operationalize sex in the research? (male and female ang dapat sanang sagot)

Girl seatmate ko: (busy na nagbabasa ng script, pagkarinig ng 'sex' biglang tumingala) Frequency?

<biglang humagalpak sa tawa ang boys sa class>

Sir: Puwede, puwede. Pero ako I'd prefer quality.
Prof (at a guy coming in late): Tingnan mo itong lalaking ito. Naka shorts, naka tsinelas. Mukhang galing lang sa banyo.

eee10, may estudyante na ang likot-likot sa upuan niya..

prof: are you trying to wake up your classmates or are you looking for a better position to sleep?

PROF : Sino dito nagtake na ng previous English course?
ME (xempre pa-impress) : Sir, me. English 11.
PROF : May natutunan ka naman?
ME : Of course sir..
PROF : Anong mga stories binasa nyo sa English 11?
ME : Sir, I don't remember.
PROF : You don't remember?! And this was last sem? What was your grade in English 11?
ME : Sir, 1.5 po.
PROF : She should have given you a 4!

English 12

PROF : What is English 12? You have English 10, English 11, English 12. Para yan sa kinder. Pag kinder 1, hindi pa marunong magamit ng toilet paper. Pag kinder 2, medyo marunong na.

English 12

PROF : O, ikaw, ano naman course mo?

ME : PolSci po. But magshishift po ako sa ComLit.
PROF : Ay. Marami ng tangga sa English Department. Dadagdagan mo pa.

English 12

PROF : O, ikaw naman, ne, ano naman ang course mo? (YES, TAGALOG XIA!)

NE : FLCD

PROF : Ano naman yan?

NE : Family Life and Child Development po. Sa College of Home Economics.

PROF : Ay. Home Economics. They should burn down that college. Nag-aral ka pa. Nag-asawa ka na lang sana. Mag-aasawa ka naman lang dun.

One day, I felt like wearing a plain yellow collared shirt, a semi-faded basic cut maong pants and black rubber shoes. I felt pretty decent with my attire. It was that unique feeling only smart casual attire gives you.

The classroom only had one door, CAL building kasi, eh. At 'yung door na 'yun, pagpasok mo pa lang, blackboard at prof na makakasalubong mo. Pagpasok ko ng classroom, hulaan niyo suot ng prof...

Plain yellow collared shirt, semi-faded basic cut maong pants and black rubber shoes. Shit.

Everytime bago sya magkwento tungkol sa mga bagay na pwedeng maging "controversial", laging sinasabi ng prof namin sa Management:

"Don't quote me, I will deny."
-Sir Ham.

Malaki ang nagawa ng EDSA Revolution sa aking UP Education.  Dahil sa kanya, nalampasan ko ang Math 11! Lahat kami, " P" ( Passed) ang grade. Napilitan yung titser naming ipasa na lang kami kasi maagang natapos ang school year dahil sa mga rally :D Nyahahahahaha.

"Kung ikaw ay nasistress, shift... -Le Chatelier"

wow miss, ang ganda naman ng cleavage mo. --nat sci 2 prof discussing physical properties of minerals
"I do not give make-up exams unless you are dead or dying."

Last year, this Korean dude studying at UP asked me for directions. He asked me A LOT of questions, about where this building is and how he could get there. But the one thing which made it worth it was his last question: "Umm, can you tell me where I can find the, umm, uhh, Palm Hall?"

WTH?! "PALM HALL"??? Di ko napigilan talagang natawa ako sa unahan niya, yung hagulhol. Sorry, Korean guy!!! XDDD

A group of freshies to a group of upper class girls: ate saan yung TBA?
Upper class: derechohin nyo yang hall na yan tpos kanan ka dun sa dulo.
TBA -> To Be Announce. (ang sama!)
Nakakawa naman yung ibang schools. NOT!

Socsci 1 Prof: "Ang pag-ibig kapag nagugutom, lumilipad. Kaya ikaw Ms. Rizada, mag-asawa ka ng mayaman."

Ms. Rizada: K.
"Class is canceled, can't stand body heat."

Eto, maraming makaka-relate sa quote na ito ng isa naming prof.
"Para sa mga kumuha ng CMSC 56, 56, 57, 123, 123, 123, infinite loop ...."

One fine Tuesday in 2004, Dr. Gerardo Sicat was doing a one-hour large class lecture for Econ 11, it was about the Game Theory by John Nash. 
Then he said: "His life was made into a movie. What's the title of that movie, again? Starring Russel Crowe? A BEAUTIFUL BRAIN?"
The entire SE Auditorium roared with laughter. Tapos *tambling*

Alin ang mas masakit? Yung matapakan ng nakatakong yung ingrown mo o yung makagat ng lamok yung tigyawat mo?

May tally board pa yun sa baba.  Di ko lang maalala kung alin ang lamang.  Hehe.

isa pa...first meeting ng Math 17 class ko nung freshie ako. pasok si prof na bata pa. walang imik na humarap sa blackboard at nagsulat...Ch1 # 1, 3, 5, 7...Ch2 # 5, 7, 11, 13...Ch3 # 1, 3, 9, 17...hanggang kung anu man yung last chapter sa libro. pagkatapos humarap sa amin, nagpakilala at sabay sabing "These are your assignments for the whole sem.  You may opt not to do it, i don't care, and you may opt not to attend my class.  Just make sure you pass my exams."
"Welcome to the Diliman Republic!" sabi ni bagong Student Regent Kiko Pangilinan sa Freshman Orientation namin (at napgahahalata ang age ko...opo 87 ako at kakatapos lang ng EDSA)
"dalawa lang ang iskwelahan sa pilipinas - UP and others!"  kaya pag may nakita kaming cute sa gimikan ina-assess muna namin kung "others" siya.
Prof: Dalawang klaseng estudyante lang ang nakakagraduate ng UP, yung sobrang matalino at yung sobrang madiskarte.

Julia (to Wenna): You are a UP student. You are intelligent so you know this. I am just from Benedictine!

Briefing ng isang Korean sa nagchu-tutor ng kanyang mga anak:

Mr. Kim: If the other tutor would ask you how much I am paying you, donﾒt say anything because I am paying them lower than you. If they are UP students, then I will pay them higher like you.

rizal teacher, whenever he'd be a few mins late for class: "sorry class, i just had a cup of coffee. you see, coffee is the mark of a civilized man."

sige na nga!

wagi!!!

Ako at friend: *paupo sa hiya*

Prof sa Kas1 (at nagtuturo din sya ng Kas2), UPD:

-first 15 mins: discuss ng lecture. 
-the next 45 mins: kinwento nya na yung life nya. yung anak nya. yung asawa nya. yung mayor nila, etc..
-the next 15 mins: depende kung san makarating yung usapan, minsan nasa kwento parin ng buhay nya, pero minsan naman pag nakikita nya na may mga tao na sa labas for the next class, babalik na sa lecture yung sinasabi nya.
-final exam: covers lahat ng di nya nadiscuss, na nasa imbang kapal na notes nya (libro na ata yun). 

History nga.. HIS STORY :)))

pero marami akong natutunan sa kanya. Natutunan ko ang kwento ng bigas, at marami pang bagay na wala sa librong common na binabasa about philippine history. At mataas naman sya magbigay ng grade. Higit sa lahat, passion nya talaga history.. kaya masasabi kong ok parin syang prof :) haha..

3 a.m. Naglalakad ako sa may CMC pabalik ng Molave. At dahil UP Fair, sino pa nga ba ang masasalubong mo sa daan kundi mga JJ. Dumaan ako sa gitna group nila (pito sila nun). Whether nairita sila or naangasan sila, hindi ko na alam dahil bigla nalang may bumato sakin ng piraso ng hollow block na galing dun sa ginagawang daan. Siyempre humarap ako nilabas ung balisong ko.

1989, UPLB, sa klaseng Speculative Thought ni Prof Gerry Intia, tinatanong niya kami kung ano ang alam namin sa pagkatao namin nung mga musmos pa kami. Almost all of our answers were, of course, based on stories that mostly relatives would tell us later on nung malalaki't mas may malay na kami. After hearing everything we had to say about ourselves, Prof. Intia suddenly let loose this "mother" of all questions: 

"If you were too young to remember back then, how can you be so sure that even your own mother is telling you the truth about you?"

Medyo masama yung joke pero oh well.

One of our professors in one of our hardest lab subjects--which people cry tears of blood over, well, at least I did--has this mixed CD of songs he uses as background music for our final practical exam. (I don't know if he still does this.) He plays it right when we start, and when the last two songs play, that means you're supposed to finish your preparations and have them ready to be submitted by the time the CD ends. One of the songs, I think, is Closing Time. But we really hate when we hear the lyrics of the next song:

"I tried so hard and got so far. But in the end, it doesn't even matter. I  had to fall, to lose it all. But in the end it doesn't even matter."

said: "Okay, going back to gravity."

KAKAKITA NG MGA JJs (Jumping Jologs) SA UPLB AY NAGAWA NA NAMIN SILANG I-GRUPO GRUPO...

1. FJs or Fighting Jologs - JJs na may mga hawak na mga kawayan o kahit ano mang stick na panghampas.

2. JLOs or Jologs Lovers - JJs na nagmamahalan sa fpark.

3. G I-JOs or GulpIng Jologs - JJs na umiinom ng Gulp.

4. RJs or Riding Jologs - JJs na nagbabike at madalas na nagnono-hands. Magaling!

5. JS/Pro or Jologs Senior/Professional - JJs na may mga asawa't anak na at may mga trabaho.

6. FPJs or Fantastic Playing Jologs - JJs na sporty.

An inter-ocean liner was about to sink and there were not enough lifeboats. Each lifeboat has a maximum capacity of only 20 passengers. One last lifeboat contained 23 passengers and three brave volunteers are needed to make a life sacrifice so that others may live. 

An American stood up and shouted "Long live America!" and dived into the water. He was immediately devoured by the sharks. 

The second volunteer was Spanish who cried out "Viva Espana!" before he plunged into the ocean and was eaten by sharks. 

All was quiet while they await the third one. And a  third one did stand up and proudly declared: "Mabuhay ang Filipino!". Then pushed the Vietnamese into the water.

My BA 290 instructor and i were having lunch at chocokiss, you know, those ultra rare moments when you get to spend quality time with your MA Adviser.  We were discussing just casual things - family, friends, ofcourse, our work and (siyempre) my MA.
me (serious mode dahil family and work ang napagusapan):  well maam, i finally realized that it's true what they say that when you get to a certain age, you just learn to accept the realities of life, with all it's shortcomings.  you know, just deal with it head on.
Prof A (natawa):  ang bata mo pa hija, and you've touched self actualization.  that's why people brought up by UP is a cut above the rest.

(una na, siyempre pa, we know maslow e ha ha.  that's when i realized, even just hanging out and joking around with UP Profs would eventually *and definitely* go into intellectual conversations.  one of my proudest and happiest moments.  ever.  i still visit with that professor everytime i'm in manila.)

ghost story sa main lib (urban legend siguro, but still freaky):

there was this girl daw who did some research, inabot ng 10pm, & dumaan muna sa CR before umuwi.  pag pasok nya raw walang tao and she took the corner stall.  while she was doing her business, there was this thing that kept thumping rhythmically on her forehead, like tapping a pen on the forehead.  she was nervous kasi during that time nagaayos ng mga wirings, baka makuryente sya.  when she got out, naabutan nya yung guard.  sinabi nya sa guard yung concern nya, na baka may makuryente.  sagot ng guard, "tapos na mag ayos ng wires diyan kahapon.  teka anong araw ba ngayon (checks the date)... aaaah baka si Portia yun.  death anniv nya ngayon, diyan siya nagbigti.  dami ngang nagkukuwento na minsan daw nararamdaman nila yung paa nya na tumatama sa kanila."

Enlistment. AY 2003-2004 ata ito. Kuwento ng classmate kong babae.

Classmate: May slot pa po ba sa Kas X ni Sir *Z*?
RA: Naku, wala na e. Sa ibang schedule ka na lang mag-enlist.
Classmate: Ayoko. Gusto ko kay *Z*. Magaling daw yun at pogi pa (sabay tingin sa kaibigan niya). Basta kay *Z* ako. Ayoko sa iba, kay *Z* lang ako. Maghihintay na lang ako, sana may magcancel.
RA: Usually walang nagkacancel sa mga GE subjects (nangingiti na yung RA).
Classmate: Magpreprerog na lang ako sa kanya kung wala talaga.

Nag-stay pa ng ilang minutes si classmate. Umasa talaga. Maya-maya, may mga estudyanteng lumapit sa enlistment table.

The trouble with visiting relatives when you are a UP student:

Relative X: Iha! Kamusta ka na. Graduate ka na ba?
Ako: Ah, eh... Hindi pa po.
Relative X: Saan ka nga uli nag-aaral?
Ako: *Shy, subdued voice* Sa... UP po...
Relative X: *Disappointed* Oh, eh bakit parang ikinahihiya mo ang eskuwelahan mo? Dapat PROUD ka at nasa UP ka! Aba'y hindi basta-basta makapasok diyan, ah!

Lesson learned. Later during the same day, with a different relative:

Relative Y: Uy! Kamusta ka na. Graduating?
Ako: Um... Hindi pa po, isang taon pa po.
Relative Y: Ah, kasabayan mo pala yung pinsan mo, no? Ga-graduate na rin siya next year. Saang school ka nga uli?
Ako: *Proud, with a smile* Sa UP po!
Relative Y: *Annoyed* Hmph. Ang yabang mo naman. Oe no ngayon kung UP ka? Por que't UP ka, sobrang talino mo na ba? *Irap*

(-_-) Huh. Sa susunod, pag tinanong ako kung saan ako nag-aaral, ang isasagot ko, "SA ESKUWELAHAN PO! :D"

Sa Socsci 2 class namin noon sa UPLB, circa 1997. Nag-roll call ang prof namin. Eh yung brod ko, nilagay nya sa attendance sheet yung pangalan ng crush nya na di naman namin kaklase. Tawag ng tawag yung prof sa pangalane nung crush nya at dahil nga walang sumasagot, nagalit na tuloy sya at tinatanong kung istydyante ba yun sa klase nya. So sabi ng mga kaklase namin, wala naman silang kilalang ganung pangalan. Kaya galit na tinanong kami kung sino nagsulat nun. Eh nahalata ng prof. namin na nagtatalo na kami ng brod ko kasi pinapaamin ko na sya na sya nagsulat nun. Kaya tinawag nya yung brod ko:

Prof.: Marlon, ikaw ba nagsulat ng Kathy ***** dito sa attendance sheet?
Marlon: Sir hindi ah! Hindi po 'ko nagsusulat ng kabit-kabit.
Prof: At pa'no mo naman nalamang kabit-kabit ang pagkakasulat nito ha??!!!!!

Hagalapakan lahat ng mga kaklase namin eh! Ibinuking nya sarili nya, he he he!!!!

read this awhile ago. it's a response on why in UP we only have 15-18 units as compared to 24 units of other schools.  

"Hi Thomas. I think the reason being, sobrang demanding ang every subject sa UP whether it is a 3-unit or a 5-unit subject. Every prof demands a mastery of his/her subject at wala silang paki kung magkasabay man ang mga exams mo, that is why a 15-unit load in a semester is the brim for a desirable workload. I canﾒt imagine having a 24-unit load in a semester. Pag meron kang 18 units in one semester, patay na ang social life mo nyan. 24? Patay ka na. :D"

Sa LRT, habang papunta kaming magkakaklase sa CCP Cruise Bay
Terminal, ewan ko ba, pero napadako ang aming usapan sa INERTIA.

Hanggang sa mayroong magbigay ng kanyang sariling
definition.

"INERTIA is when you ride a train in the LRT, and the train suddenly
stops...And you move like this *moving sidewards to the left* and that
*moving sidewards to the right*." (Leslie Parungao, 2010)

UPM (nonverbatim)
During Histo II Class 
 May nagrereport about East Asia (Japan, China, N. and South Korea). Dahil dapat creative ang report, "Matanglawin" ang parang theme ng report at syempre merong Kuya Kim
Sa report, nag-invite ng guests si "Kuya Kim" from Japan, China and N. and S. Korea
Blockmate as Kuya Kim: Now, let's welcome our guests from S. Korea...the Girl's Generation
*class applauds*
Blockmate as Kuya Kim: Since hindi pinayagan ng leader nila, walang tayong guest from North Korea...
*class laughs*
Blockmate as Kuya Kim: From China, let's welcome Mulan and friends :))
*class again applauds*
Blockmate as Kuya Kim: and now, from Japan.. SUDOKU and friends!
*short awkward silence para magprocess*
other reporters: SADAKO!!!
*hysterical laughter from the class*
Blockmate as Kuya Kim: Sadako and friends
haha :))

UPV.7am POLSCI 170 (Comparative Western Politics) class last sem..

as usual, prof V. was late. he then told us to get a sheet of paper for a quiz.. 

the question was about the westminster model.. pero iniba nya ung second word na d ko na matandaan (produkto ng pagkabagsak ko.tsk--repression.. haha) 

because we haven't read the reading for that meeting..my classmates and i tried hard to extract some of our creative juices para masagutan ung tanong (definiton lang naman ata).. pero there were some (mga lima sila) na hndi nakasulat dahil sa time limit.. (and i bet.. di rin sila nakapag basa.. haha)

then,Prof V. checked our papers..tas kinuha nya ung mga papel na walang sulat at minarkahan ng 1.0.. samantala, lahat ng may sulat ay nagkadungis ng 5.0.. 

tsktsk.. there.. our prof caught us. we seldom read the assigned readings.. 

share lang..  LMAO

Sa MATH 17 class ko long time ago sa Math Building, UPLB, may mga pumapasok na mga pulibi na namumulot ng bote. At first, pasok lang ako, keri lang, 'wag pansinin habang umuupo sa silya.

Nag-klase na kami (hi Ma'am Den!). Umalis lang saglit si Ma'am, may kukunin daw sa faculty room. Nagsusulat lang ako ng notes nung biglang may narinig akong kaluskos sa unahan. Pagkatingin ko, isang pulibi sukbit ang kanyang sako ay biglang nagtatatakbo sa harap papunta sa bintana. Eh madulas nun (as usual, sino ba nagma-mop ng floors ng MB?), kaya slide bigla si bata ala-baseball na mawawalan ng base. Sabay tayo, kinuha ang bote sa bintana at kumaripas ulit paglabas. 

Magagaling talaga mga bata dito sa LB, ang lulupet. XD
Read the other overheards (Ateneo, DLSU, and the UST) and notice the big difference. LOL. Btw, the UST ang sa uste kasi may isa pang overheard at ust na isang uni sa US.

In our CHEM class yesterday, our professor discussed about phase diagrams.

Prof: "Anong phase kapag mataas ang temperature?" (Yeah, he used tagalog.)

*silence*

Prof: "Mamimili lang kayo, liquid or solid?"

Class: (after a few seconds) "Gas."

Prof: "Parang di kayo sigurado sa sagot nyo a. E pano pag mataas naman ang pressure?"

*crickets crickets*

Prof: "Diba, most probably, liquid yun?...

Di nyo naman kailangang sauluhin yung phase diagram e. Akala ko common sense lang ang kailangan dyan.

Wala na kayong common sense? DOTA na lang ba kayo ng DOTA?"

One student whispered to his classmate...

Student: "Ano yung DOTA?!"

I was like, yeah, right.

Mom ko nagtuturo ng folk dance sa HK majors. May student sya na cute na cute na bball player na 1st crush ko sa UP. So my mom told me what happened sa class nila that day kasi parati kong kinakamusta si crush. 

They were practicing Tinikling that day, at nagkakanda-ipit ang paa ni crush. Sabi ni mama "Ano ba naman _____! Kaya natatalo ang basketball team natin kasi ang point guard walang coordination eh!" Pulang pula si crush sa kahihiyan. Buti na lang cutie pa sya lalo ^_^

First Sem, first day of classes, Freshmen Orientation sa UP Theater, then nag-disperse na kami with our blocks. So, sabi ng aming blockhandlers sa European Languages block (B6 2001), "Say your name, taga-saan ka, and the language you want to major in."  So we were in a circle taking turns to introduce ourselves (e.g. Nina/ Q.C./ German; Mabei/Manila/Spanish, etc.). 

Yun isa naming blockmate, she said her name tapos, "taga ano ako... dyan lang, sa Miriam..." -__- 

I was thinking, "Ha? sa Miriam sya nakatira? Nakakahiya naman, lahat kami sinabi namin saan probinsya or city kami galing tapos sya kung saang school sya galing..." Super funny lang na talagang kailangang sabihin nya yun high school nya when walang ibang nagsabi ng sarili nilang hs. Well, eventually she became my kabarkada and super ok syang tao. Weird lang talaga nung first day kasi baka may hangover pa sya ng hs nya. hahaha.

I had Soc Sci 2 class with some MBB majors. One of them is a Babaylan. Nung end na ng sem, nagbonding ang buong class. So nakwento nya na the night before, na-hold-up sya sa Monumento bus nung pauwi sya sa kanila. 

Mangiyak-ngiyak sya nang innenumerate nya yung mga nakuha sa kanya: "yun bag ng ate ko, yun wallet ko, yun notes ko... at higit sa lahat... yun make-up kit ko, na ang tagal kong pi-nut together.... yun ang pinakaimportanteng laman ng bag ko." Lahat kami mangiyak-ngiyak din. We really felt his/her pain. Until now naaalala ko mukha nya. Sya yung pinakamatalino sa class and pinakamabait and friendly..

nagpagtripan namin ng orgmates ko na magparamihan ng mga kalokohang acronyms ng ibang universities.. eto ung mga nakuha kong mganda..(credits nlng dun sa mga nkaimbento tlaga nito)
ADMU-  Ang Daming Mali sa Upcat. Ang Dumi Malapit sa UP. Ang Daming Mayamang Ugok
FEU-  ForEver Useless... Failed to Enter UP
ADU-  Ambisyon Din ang UP... Ako'y Dead sa Upcat
DLSU-  Di Lumusot Sa Upcat... Dunong La, Salapi Umaapaw
UE-  UP Expelled... Ubod ng Epal... Unibersidad na Echos
UST- UP Sana Tayo... Utot Sabay Tae... Useless Students of Tomorrow... Unibersidad na Sagana sa Tubig
NU- Never nag-Upcat... Not a University
UPHS- UP, Pangarap na Hindi Sumaakin
PUP- Pekeng UP
MAPUA- Meron Akong Panaginip, UP Ako

(hehe, yabang talaga)

third year kami non, we we're invited to join ung paskong pinoy festival sa ccp so nagjoin kami. nung parade night na, 2nd to the last kami kasunod namin ung float ng st. benilde ata un. ah basta ung skul na yun sa taff. may smoke machine ung float nila (mayaman.. hehe) ang haba nung parade. super pagod na kami at ang dilim na (walang bukas na street light) wala na kaming makita sa nilalakaran namin (in short it was turning to be a boring and exhausting night) nang biglang... nagliyab ung float ng st. benilde (may sumigaw pa ng "sunog!"). takbuhan kami bigla. kahit wala ng energy at nadadapa ung iba samin. may narinig kasi kaming sumigaw na sasabog daw ung float. haha ung boring and exhausting night naging "run for your life" scene.

kanina nagdiscuss kami about sa BOR meet mamayang9am sa Quezon Hall.

student: ano pa lang problema kay Student Regent?

kami: ah kasi ayaw po syang paupuin bilang student regent kasi na-late sya sa pagfile ng residency. pero pinayagan naman siyang sumali sa voting nung december para sa directorship sa PGH. pagdating ng january gustong palitan yung na-elect, pero bago pa man gawin ay kelangang ma-nullify yung vote nya. nung february po di na sya pinapasok sa meeting.

student: ahh. e sino ba yung pinalit na director?

kami: ah si Domingo po, kahit hindi siya ang next in line.at alam nyo po ba na si Domingo ay dapat tatakbo sa 2nd district sa Pampanga, kaso kinausap siya ni GMA.

student: Ahhh (sabay tango ng ulo)

kami: mahalaga po ang student regent ate lalo na't ang daming mga additional fees at increases na nakasalang ngayon. walang dedepensa sa atin. at isa pa, tayo naman po ang pumili sa kanya, bakit nila siya tatanggalin?

Summer 2007 habang kumakain kami sa LB, biglang nasunog yung bahay sa likod ng post office. Nag alala kami ng mga kasama ko kasi nakatira sa boarding house sa tapat ng nasusunog na bahay yung isa naming kaibigan. Gusto naming pumunta sa harap ng post office para dun siya hanapin kasi dun nagsipunta mga tao pero di kami makadaan sa harap ng bahay na nasusunog kaya pumunta pa kami sa may track oval at dumaan ng sanggumay. Habang tumatakbo may nakasalubong kaming ale na nakikiusisa sa sunog.

Ale: Bakit daw nagkaroon ng sunog?
Kami: Galing daw po sa manukan. (Narinig lang namin mula sa mga nagkakagulong mga tao)

Tapos nagmadaling tumakbo papuntang post office. 

After a few minutes, nakita namin yung ale sa may bandang molave ata (di pa namin nakikita yung kaibigan namin) tapos kinausap niya kami.

Ale: Oi may sunog dun o. Galing daw sa manukan.
Kami: Ah...*nagpipigil ng tawa sabay takbo*

our STS classes, under the late prof. Salvador Carlos were held in a room at the 4th pav (bio) in Palma hall. 

In the midst of a report on Alvin Toffler's Third Wave (1st wave-agricultural revolution; 2nd wave-industrial revolution; 3rd wave-computer age), a commotion started sa may AS walk dahil may frat rumble. 

Prof. Carlos told us to close the doors. 

Biglang may sumabog na pill box sa labas. Tahimik ang lahat, feeling the tension in the air. 

Tapos, prof. Carlos blurted out, "Yun, second wave technology yon." Tawanan na ang lahat. 

Tuloy ang report. :)

I felt hopeless when I was answering my Chem 33 exam. I wrote the last page of my blue book, along with the calculation doodles, "God, please help me pass this exam."

When the Chem Prof. returned my paper, in my surprise,, he told us that "Students should not really on divine intervention. You should study. *evil laugh*" I immediately checked my note on the scratch and my note to God was encircled with his blue pen and wrote a comment: "You should study harder."

habang naglalakad papuntang stat (late na sa class) may sasakyang huminto sa tapat ko, isang mejo may edad ng babae ang nagtanong skn, "miss, san ung laboratory dito?" sabi ko: ay ano po bang laboratory?madaming po kasing lab dito. nagtanong uli,"bsta ung sa school.san ba un?" syempre sumagot ulit ako: ano po bang school?maami dn po kasing school dito, like ngayon po papunta akong school of stat. nagtanong ulit na parang naiirita na,"may ipapacheck lang kase kami sa UP, san ba ung papuntang UP?" sumagot ako kahit sumasakit na ulo ko sa tanong nya: nasa UP na po kayo. dpa rin sya nasiyahan, at may dumaang kakilala ko, sila na ang nag-usap tapos umalis na ung sasakyan. tinanong ko ung kakilala ko kung anong ngyari, tinanong pa daw kung saan ung labasan, at syempre ang sagot ulit,"labasan po papunta saan?madami dn po kasing labasan dito". nairita na yta ng tuluyan kaya umalis na.haha

UP Baguio:
Kahapon, Friday March 19, 2010 --> HELL DAY.
Dahil sa araw na yun may 2 projects, exam at reporting ako hindi ko na nagawang matulog..  Pagkastart ng exam ng 10am, ramdam na ramdam ko na ang antok, sa sobrang antok ko hindi ko na namalayang nakatulog ako. Pag ka gising ko ang nakita kong oras ay 11:45, eh ang reporting ay 11:30, kaya under 15 mins tinapos ko agad ang exam, alis ng room, sabay takbo.

Pagdating ko sa room kung san kami magrereport walang tao, sakto nakasalubong ko kagroup ko. Tinanong ko sya kung nasan ibang kagroup namin, ang sabi nya hindi nya daw alam. Nagtaka ako bat hindi nya alam eh kami na magrereport. THE FUNNY THING IS PAGTINGIN KO SA CLOCK 11AM PA LANG!!

Our CommArts class was already ongoing  when this lanky guy with a black ball cap suddenly barged into the room (The room had only one door and the seating arrangement was facing it). He looked really exhausted and was sweating all over as he proceeded straight to the back. He quickly found a vacant seat at the rearmost row, next to my seat, to my right. The whole class suddenly went silent as all of us were so surprised looking at the new face. Our professor began, "Excuse me! Are you enrolled in this class?" "Yup!" he confidently answered back. "May I know ur name? Sorry, but it's our first time to see you come to my class," the professor continued. Realizing his faux pas, he apologized and left the room just as quickly. His class was on the adjacent room.

Last meeting na ng Chem 1 class namin yesterday, and I guess the most striking thing sa class na yun ay tuwing nagse-share si Ma'am (I won't disclose her name) ng anecdotes.

Reviewing my mental notes of her discussions, I realized na lahat ng tao sa stories niya (usually mga chem people din na acquaintances and friends ni prof) ay lahat nangamatay na, o may sakit. At laging connected sa lessons namin ang dahilan ng kanilang mga unfortunate circumstances. So every meeting, my death story siya for us.

Ang morbid siguro, pero amazingly parang konti lang sa amin sa class ang nakapansin. XD

Sa Shakey's (SM Dasma Branch)...
Student, mahigit dalawang minuto nang nakaupo, hindi pinapansin ng mga waiter sa paligid. Dahil sa asar, kinausap ang lalaking napatingin sa kanya sa katapat na table:

Student: Excuse me. Nakikita mo ba ko?

Lalaki: Ahh. Oo. (Napatingin ang nanay, tatay at kuya ng lalaki sa estudyante.)

Student: Nakikita niyo naman po ako no?

(Hindi sumagot ang buong pamilya. May kakaibang ekspresyon sa kanilang mga mukha.)

Student: Hindi naman po ako invisible di ba?

Tatay: Oo. (Mas tumindi ang ekspresyon sa mukha ng buong pamilya.)

Student: Ah. Para kasing hindi ako nakikita ng mga waiter eh.

Buong pamilya: *chuckles* (Hindi malaman kung natuwa ang buong pamilya dahil sa sinabi ng estudyante o kung narelieve sila sa realization na hindi ito baliw.)

P.S. Ang pamilya ang gumawa ng paraan para may kumuhang waiter sa order ng estudyante.

Finals week, 2nd sem. Friday before lunch. Mga 5 minutes akong nakatunganga sa board nung faculty room, kasi naman yung nakapost na class standing, andaming 4.0 sa amin (kasama ako shempre). Tapos yung nakalagay na removals is Monday, 6.30 am. Medyo nagpapanic na sa sobrang aga plus mga deadlines pa for the weekend. Biglang labas si Prof:

ako: Sir, totoo ba to? Ang aga naman ata?
Prof: Oo. (with matching smile pa..)
ako: (Tahimik lang, dina makakontra..)

Bumalik ako mga 5:30 after class sa isa pang major. Ayun may nakapost ulit, may note pa sa side (not exact):

"Please disregard previous post. Removals on Wednesday, 9-12am. Happy April Fool's Day!:)"

At ang panalo dun, 3.0 pala standing ko..Pag ganitong instances talaga ang sarap makakuha ng tres..:D

UPMin 
Klase namin sa fst 101 (food chemistry) and ma'am D discussed how civet coffee was made. Kami ay interesado kaya nakinig ang lahat.

Ma'am D: ang civet cofee ay nakukuha sa poo poo ng civet cat sa coffe beans na kinain niya. Ang process is civet cats only choose ripe coffee beans sa mga sanga. Kaya nga nagtataka ang mga farmers kung bakit nawawala yung mga hinog na coffee beans. Kinakain ng civet cat... ay hindi.. chinu.chupa ng civet cat ang coffee beans...

Mga estudyante: (natameme sa narinig, pinipigilang tumawa sa harap niya pero ang iba hindi naktiis at tumawa. buti na lang hindi niya napansin)

I am in no position to tell members what and what not to post. Pero
sana, maging sensitive tayo sa mga pinaglalalagay natin dito. I
personally think that this should go without saying. Taga UP tayo di ba?

Everyone is entitled to their own beliefs. However, how we express these beliefs is an entirely different question.

(Part 2/2)

xxx

I was moved to comment to a thread that spun off a picture posted by
(name withheld) - it was an ad for a UP grad 'caregiver/PA'. The
comments
centered around the theme that such a job was beneath a UP grad.

I
work because I have kids to feed and people to take care of. Christian,
believe me, when you have to put food on the table, you're grateful for
the opportunities that come your way.

Medyo nag-init ako sa
thread because of what I felt was the lack of respect shown for
individual choices, and for the ad itself na nananahimik. Karapatan ng
client to specify a UP grad if he wants. I'm sure there are UP grads
out there who would be interested in such a position if it suits them.
That was my point which another commenter, (name withheld), doesn't get. The
issue, for me, is respect. Why all this bashing, all this negativity,
all this high-and-mighty attitudes?

xxx

(Part 1/2)

Good morning members.

I received a message regarding an image that was recently posted here in the group and the comments therein. The ad was for a caregiver/ PA job where one of the qualifications, among others, was that he be a UP graduate.

I get how we are all proud that we are from UP. However, there is that line between being proud and being boastful. The concern was raised by a UPD alumna (undergrad) who is currently taking her PhD in UPD as well.

I quote the pertinent parts of the message:

Madaling araw habang nag-aaral with housemates, naisipan naming bumili ng pagkain sa labas.

Nagpunta kaming Mini Stop para bumili na lang ng hotdog. Pero wala na din silang hotdogs dahil frozen pa daw.

Kaya nagdecide na kaming magpuntang 7-11 sa SU kahit na malayo. Habang naglalakad na kami sa may Palm Promenade papuntang 7-11, hinarang kami ng mga Chaleko Boys.

Ako (nairita): Wala na pong hotdog e!
Chaleko Boy 1: Curfew na po kasi.
Ako (pabulong): Bakit ang dami dami pang tao?

Sabay walkout na.

Kaasar. Dati naman wala na sila ng mga ganung oras. Gustong gusto pa naman naming ng hotdog. Haha.

ﾓA man for othersﾔ is how the Ateneo wants its graduates to become. But 
if its choice of commencement speakers is any indication, ﾓa man for 
othersﾔ simply means businessman, politician and Ateneo graduate. I 
donﾒt know that the rich and powerful naturally qualify as ﾓman for 
others,ﾔ theyﾒve always struck me as being ﾓothers for man,ﾔ or ﾓothers 
for me,ﾔ which was how they became rich and powerful to begin with. 
Balzac did offer profundity in lieu of platitude when he said that

A text joke passed to me by my dormmate:

A Philo prof was challenging one of his students..
Prof: To see is to believe. You, have you seen God?

Prof: No.

Dr. Jose Dalisay: "You're in UP 'cause you can think and speak for yourselves by your own wits and on your own 2 feet. And you can do so no matter what the rest of the people in the room maybe thinking. You're in UP 'cause no one can tell you to shut up if you have something sensible and vital to say. You're in UP 'cause you dread not the poverty of material comforts but the poverty of the mind. And you're in UP 'cause you care about something abstract and sometimes as treacherous as the idea of "nation", even if it kills you."
From me to her: "I'm sorry to hear that you had to spend thousands to learn these concepts from universities abroad. I learned them in UP at 900 pesos!"

This afternoon, I was touring my sister around campus when we encountered the legendary Zorro. As an incoming freshie, my sister was scared of his appearance and bizarre actions. 
But to our surprise, he patted me on the shoulder and shouted, "Ang ganda niyo!"; to which I replied with a thumbs up and a hearty "salamat!". When I turned back to my sister, she was so shocked she didn't understand what Zorro had said. ASTIG. :)

Corni to pero isang hindi malilimutang linya sa Chem31.1 sa UPD

Teacher: Class, kahit napakabango ng benzaldehyde, hindi sya pwedeng tikman.

Sa pagkakaalala ko, nakabasag ako ng micro test tube sa pagka-O_o ko.

Former Arki Dean Juguillon: I will deduct a point for every wrong grammar in your exam.

Former Classmate: Why is that, Sir? Hindi naman English 1 ito, this is Acoustics.

DJ: You are UP students. When and if you graduate, you will be facing your clients and speaking to them perhaps in English. Syempre, bilang graduate ng UP, nakakahiya na mali-mali ang English mo, hindi ba?

Eh ano pa nga ba, may choice ka ba? Unfortunately, now that I am in the States, kung magkamali man ang Pilipino sa grammar sa harap ng mga katutubo (kasi kami ang dayuhan), okay lang at bale wala. Hindi ka nila iko-correct. Hindi ka rin nila pagtatawanan. Hulaan ninyo kung sino ang nagtatawa? Yung katabi mong Pinoy! Ano ba ito?

So mali ang amin Dean! The reason for learning correct grammar is not for anyone but for ourselves. If you take up one subject, be sure to be good at it (at least). And if it is your major, strive for the best. Bakit rin? Kasi UPian ka! Tama ba o mali?

A judge, feeling that his integrity and dignity were being assaulted, went on the offensive with a prideful rant against a lawyer.. 

Judge: Sir, are you from the College of Law of the University of the Philippines?
Lawyer: No, your Honor, from Manuel L. Quezon University, your Honor.
Judge: No, youﾒre not from UP.
Lawyer: I am very proud of it.
Judge: Then youﾒre not from UP. Then you cannot equate yourself to me because there is a saying and I know this, not all law students are created equal, not all law schools are created equal, not all lawyers are created equal despite what the Supreme Being said that we all are created equal in His form and substance.

Some of my blockmates joked that we could use this as a quip against students from the downtown law school. Hahaha. Ang training nga naman sa UP Law, it's either you become so condescendingly proud and overly convinced of your superiority or you become the most humble and modest of all..

Hi mga isko at iska! Mag-aral kayong mabuti. Makinig kayo sa mga classes nyo dahil magagamit nyo lahat yan pag nagwork na kayo.

Priceless yung pagpasa sa UPCAT at mas rewarding pag grumaduate ka ontime. Incentive na lang yung pagiging "laude". 

Personally, narealize ko na iba pa rin ang dugong UPian lalo na pag nasa fiel...d ka na.

INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY ka na ng workplace mo.

Narealize ko din na mas "cool" pa rin ang UP environment at UP people compared sa outside world. 

We don't have to step down and try to fit to OTHERS. Be proud 'coz once UP released you, you better stand up and out. 

Huwag mo hayaang dalhin ka ng UP. Dapat ikaw ang nagdadala sa UP.
guys, join din kayo sa "UP naming mahal".... meet natin mga katulad nating taga-UP.. :)

Lessons Learned:
- Itanong muna ang pangalan. Itanong din ang batch [para alam mo kung paano mo kakausapin] at course.
- 'Wag nang magbait-baitan kung hindi ka naman talaga mabait.

wahaha!

2nd sem '09-'10 registration. I had finished everything by the end of the first regular day. It was my best registration so far. When I got back home, my phone rang.

Non-verbatim.

Me: Hello?

Registration Assistant (RA): Hello, is this Jean?

Me: Yes?

RA: Ah. Okay, so.. this is *something something* from the Regcom... na-validate mo na lahat ng classes mo, 'di ba?

Me: Opo?

RA: Nakapagbayad ka na?

Me: Opo?

RA: Pero kasi, dissolved na 'yung ES 12 class mo.

Me: Ah... Ganun po ba?

RA: Oo.

RA: Bale maghahanap ka na lang ng bagong klase to replace 'yung ES 12, three units din. Okey lang ba 'yun sa 'yo?

Me: Eh.. Wala naman akong choice.. 'di ba..?

RA: Ah. Well...

RA: So yun, please look for a new class na lang.

Me: Okay thanks bai. ;_;

May istudyante akong na-miss ang exam. Pagka-next meeting, kinausap ko after class at tinanong bakit na-miss niya exam. 
Ang sagot sa akin, "Nakalimutan ko ma'am e."
Medyo natigilan ako. Paano nga naman kung honest mistake na nakalimutan. Sinabi ko pa rin, hindi yun kasama sa valid excuses. Kasama sa responsibilidad ng istudyante na alalahanin ang mga requirements niya.
Ang sagot niya, "Sige ma'am, mag-iisip po ako ng ibang dahilan."

Isa sa mga mahirap na gawin pag nasa UP ka ay magbigay ng directions... One time, nag-aabang ako ng jeep sa may Ilang-ilang Residence Hall nang biglang may nagstop na car at yung ate na nagddrive tinanong ako, "Miss, pano ba pumuntang College of Architecture?"

*panic mode*
Sa isip ko, "Oh no! Ate, mahirap po yun... mahina po ako sa directions..."

Pero ganito yung usapan namin. 
Ako: Ate, ittry ko pong ipaliwanag ahhh... Mejo malayo kasi mula dito.. alam niyo po ba kung saan yung Quezon Hall?
Ate: Saan yun?
Ako: Kung nasaan si Oble.
Ate: Ahhhh... Oo...

So I used Oble as the point of reference... nakabigay naman ako ng directions. sana nga lang nagets niya. haha!

Sa UPB, ZOO10 class..

Sa isang class ni Tatang (BIO/ZOO prof)..

We are asked to create an outilne and sample ng isang formal report ng isang experiment about PATATAS..

Yung sa group namin, ok na ang lahat mula sa ABSTRACT, METHODOLOGY, RESULTS AND DISCUSSION and everything.. :)
ang kulang na lang ay TITLE ng experiment...

Nagsimula ng magdiscuss yung ibang groups.. Ang mga title ng sa kanila ay "The comparative study of blah blah blah" tapos pahabaan sila ng mga titles.. tapos competitive naman ang mga groumates ko,. sabi nila.. 

"Anu na title natin? Ang kukumplikado ng sa kanila, dapat sa atin catchy.. "

I suggested: "PROBLEMATIC POTATO".. at naging catchy nga siya.. Yun naging title namin.. hehe

Sabi ni Boss mahirap daw magkaroon ng girlfriend na taga-UP. Sa sobrang talino, kapag pinapili, pinakahuli sa listahan ang lovelife. Nagbreak daw sila ng girlfriend nya (bago sila grumaduate).

Boss: Ako o mga kaibigan mo?
Girl: Kaibigan.
Boss: Ako o acads?
Girl: Tinatanong pa ba yan?
Boss: I love you (sabay yakap sa girlfri...end)
Girl: Syempre acads.
Boss: (Naluha na lang daw. Hindi lang daw sya broken-hearted, napahiya rin hindi lang sa girlfriend kundi pati sa sarili nya. At sana hindi na lang daw sya nagtanong)

*Nakakaawa yung mukha ni Boss after nya ikwento to. Parang mahal na mahal pa rin nya yung babae.

UP1: Boss manonood po kayo sa graduation?
Boss: Oo naman, andoon yung anak ko e.
UP1: Kita na lang po tayo dun Boss!
Boss: May trabaho ka ah.
UP1: Nagfile na po ako ng leave.
Boss: Ok, see you in Baguio.
UP1: Boss sa Diliman po ako manonood.
Boss: O di doon ka, ako sa Baguio, UP Baguio yung anak ko e. O baka gusto mong sumama... na ngayon kay *insert name*.
UP1: Bakit Boss?
Boss: Babyahe na siya tonight, UP Min naman anak niya. Mag-explore ka naman ng ibang UP campuses, hindi yung puro Diliman lang.
UP1: Boss isang araw lang ko finile ko e.
Boss: Sa Diliman ka na nga lang manood. 
UP1: o_0
we always go back to UP. It will always be OUR home.

Dahil malapit na naman ang pagtatapos ng mga isko at iska:

UP1: Parang gusto ko ulit pumunta sa graduation.
UP2: Bakit, may kamag-anak ka bang ga-graduate?
UP1: Wala naman. Gusto ko lang manood, makita mga outfits nila at kung sino guest speaker.
UP3: Parang gusto ko rin manood!
UP2: Bakit?
UP3: Gusto ko maramdaman ulit yung pagmartsa suot suot ang sablay, nakangiti ka habang pinapanood ka ng mga batchmates mong naunang grumaduate sayo at maalala yung panahong gustong gusto mo magtatatalon sa tuwa dahil sa wakas graduate ka na pero hindi mo magawa kasi hindi mo kilala mga kasabay mo. 
UP1&2: *sad face

100>400. Naisip ko lang: Para palang mga bundok ang mga unibersidad. Hindi mo aakyatin ang isang bundok dahil lang nag-eexist siya ng mahabang panahon. May mga bundok na bago pa lang nabubuo. At pano kung mas mataas ang bundok na yun? Yun ang aakyatin mo dahil mas matayog siya, at mas macha-challenge ka. Dahil hinahamon ka ng bundok na yun. Three UPCBA students, Carlo Ni�o C. Bautista, Emil Roxanno C. Erasmo and Naesa Maria A. Orlina, won in the Philippine National Finals of the 18th edition of the L�Oreal Brandstorm held at Ascott Makati, Glorietta 4, Ayala Center last April 14, 2010. The students and their adviser, Prof. Raymund William F. Acedera, are going to Paris, France on June 16-17 to compete with teams from 40 countries in the International Finals.

LﾒOreal Brandstorm is an international marketing game sponsored by the worldﾒs number one fragrance and cosmetics company, LﾒOreal SA. Brandstorm allows students to play the role of brand managers by turning their ideas into products while working with a global advertising agency and a packaging design agency.... See more

This yearﾒs case study product is Diesel, an iconic fashion brand known for its apparel and perfume. Students innovate as they create the next body care line for Diesel.

Dahil late ako kanina, pinatawag ako ni Boss. 

Me: (Inunahan ko na) Sir sorry po late ako.
Boss: It's ok. It's ok. First time mo naman ma-late and kung sakaling mapadalas ang pagiging late mo, makakatanggap ka naman ng memo from HR department.
Me: Sir hindi ko na ho uulitin. Gumigising naman po ako ng maaga, nagkataon lang talaga...
Boss: nagkataon lang na tinamad ka?
Me: (natahimik)
Boss: Oh see, gumigising ng maaga, tamad bumangon. Late ka talaga nyan! *Laughs* 

@ the back of my head: pinagtawanan pa ko ni Boss, siguro gawain nya rin yun.

Isang taga-CSSP, magsasauli ng libro sa Eng'g. Wala pala siyang I.D.(UPD stereotypes)

Friend 1: "Overdue na 'tong mga libro ko sa Eng'g. Paano yan wala akong I.D. eh medyo strikto pa daw naman yung guard dun!"
Friend 2: "Okay lang yan. Mag-acting ka lang."
Friend 1: "Mag-acting na kunwari haggard ako?"
Friend 2: "Mag-acting ka na haggard ka
daw at parang nagmamadali kang pumasok na tipong parang di ka na
natulog sa gabi ka kaka-aral. Tapos mag-murmur ka ng mga complicated

nun!"

So ayun nga nakapasok nga ang taga-CSSP sa Eng'g ng walang I.D. Nabalik pa niya ang mga overdue niyang libro.

Blue: Ateneo. (too proud)
Natives: Wow! Mayaman!
Green: La Salle. (mas proud pa kaysa sa atenista)
Nat......ives: Mayaman din!
Yellow: UST
Natives: Wow!
Maroons: UP. (soft voice lagi)
Natives: Wow! Matatalino!

kwento sakin nung isang taga-UP na officemate ko. Sinabi daw ni Boss yan dati.

Boss: Pakalasing tayo! Hwag na tayong magkahiyaan tutal gawain natin to nung mga estudyante pa tayo!
UP1: Namiss ko na ang college life! Iinom pag mababa ang nakukuha sa exam o pag nakakakuha ng singko.
UP2: Oh di naman kaya, iinom bago m...agtake ng exam!
La Salle1: Talaga? Ganoon pala kayo.
Boss: Oo naman, masaya kami pero grade conscious pa rin naman kahit pano.
Ateneo1: San naman kayo madalas naghahang-out?
UP3: Sa boarding house lang o kaya sa dorm.
Ateneo2: Mas masaya pag sa mga bars!
Boss: Bakit sa bar lang ba pwede bumili at uminom ng alak?
Ateneo2: Hindi naman boss pero di ba, mas cool pag sa bar.
Boss: Hindi pwede yun. 
La Salle1: Bakit boss?
Boss: Kasi kasabay ng inuman ung pagrereview namin.
UP1&2: Onga naman!

A La Sallian guy tried to impress me "AGAIN" (but in a wrong approach):

Guy: Kristina, you know the difference between La Salle & UP?
Me: Ideals &principles.
Guy: Exactly! & if we are goin' to talk about practicality,(he's too proud saying this one) La Salle is more practical than UP. Example,... if the country is experiencing oil crisis, I know what UP students will do. Gather people & rally outside Malaca�ang.
Me: Some may actually do that but not all.
Guy: I already knew it. Ok let's put it this way. What will you do if we run out of rice supplies?
Me: Look for alternatives. I can buy & eat potatoes as substitute for rice.
Guy: That's good. I thought you would engage in hunger strike.
Me: Humans will always search for something that would satisfy their needs & desires.

@ the back of my head: P.I.! Ang yabang! Ni hindi ka nga marunong magsaing tas may pa-prakti-praktikal ka pang nalalaman!

(First story)

A La Sallian guy tried to impress me (but in a wrong approach):

Guy: I know that UP students are intelligent but I don't know why you have to go out to the streets and make rally rally against the administration. Why don't you just study and make money?
Me: 'Coz we are responsible enough to deal with the soc...ial issues concerning our people. Haven't they (boss and other workmates from UP) said that we came from the University of the people made by the people for the people? One thing more, we study the issues before we mobilize.
Guy: But you won't get rich with that.
Me: Our minds are rich enough to make big money. And our hearts are rich with people. :)
Living with money alone will do you no good. Believe me.

Text Msg from sis Keng:
8 things i learned n UP
1. Suggested readings are mandatory
2. You can know everything and still fail an exam
3. All ur classmates are brilliant, others just aren't studying
4. Teachers are impressed with no one
5. Your best efforts could still get a 5
6. Every class is like a thesis defense: its not enough that you understand. u have to know how to explain it as well
7. Seatworks natin, finals sa ibang schools
8. Ang yabang natin

Naalala ko bigla... Sa informal part ng job interview ko, as in super out of the blue, bigla na lang napunta ang usapan sa religion.

(non-verbatim)
MR. PRINCIPAL: (debotong Katoliko) Totoo bang walang Diyos ang mga taga-UP?
ME: (o.O) Hindi naman po lahat, Sir...
MR. PRINCIPAL: Ah, nagsisimba din yung mga tao sa UP? (and I assumed that he was referring to Christians)
ME: (o.O) Opo, marami po. Sa Diliman po, may... (sasabihin ko sana na may mga simbahan sa UP Diliman)
MR. PRINCIPAL: Ganun... Katoliko ka?
ME: *black-out* O-opo. Nung bininyagan.
MR. PRINCIPAL: Saan ka nagsisimba?
ME: *black-out* Ganito... Kasi po, naniniwala ako kay God, pero wala po akong [actively na sinasalihang] religion...
MR. PRINCIPAL: (big grin, hampas sa table at sandal) O, sabi ko nga! UP nga naman.

UP1: Bakit maroon and green ang colors ng UP? Parehong dark, ang dull tuloy tignan. Hay, grumaduate ako na hindi ko alam yun. Nakakahiya.
UP2: Nakakahiya ka talaga.
Boss: Actually, it's not just green, it's forest green. Maroon ay fight for freedom at sa pagkakatanda ko, maroon ang pangalan nung tribo na nagtagumpay sa pagdefend ng kanilang freedom at independence mula Ingles na mananakop.
UP2: Dagdag ko lang, kaya Filipino ang pinopromote na language ng UP dahil nga sa Ingles ang mga mananakop ng tribong yun.

Dinalaw namin yung isa naming kaibigan na taga-UP din para tignan ang kanyang unang baby. (Itago natin sya sa pangalang *UP mom*. Lasalista ang kanyang asawa)

UP1: Bakit naman ganito ang kwarto ng baby nyo?
UP2: Oo, hindi naman kambal pero bakit pangdalawang bata to?
UP3: *Laughs* Emo baby vs happy baby?
UP mom: Kasi naman, sabi ko kay *insert name nung asawa*, wag munang mamili ng mga makukulay na gamit.
UP2&3: Ay tama! Black & white.
UP1: ha? Bakit?
UP2: Ano ka ba!? Hindi mo ba alam na pinakamainam ang black & white na gamit ng baby na less than 6months.
UP3: Tama!Mas mabilis nya marerecognize ang black & white then after 6mos, you can introduce more colors.
UP mom: Sinabi ko yan sa asawa ko kaso nagalit sya, wag raw tipirin si baby. Kaya sya na ang namili ng mga colorful na gamit.
UP1: So anong ginagawa mo sa Baby?
UP mom: Pag andito yung asawa ko, nakalagay si baby sa colorful side pero pag ako lang, dun kami sa black and white.

UP1,2, &3: o_0

Bawing bawi na ni Boss ang kanyang energy (after mag-attend ng graduation ng kanyang anak sa UP Baguio) kaya naman umaarangkada na naman ang mga "UP banat(s)" nya.

To all fresh UP grads:

Always remember what UP has taught and molded us. Don't forget to look back and thank the university. For what and to where you are heading right now, one thing is sure, UP principles will guide you all the way UP. You're considered as the "tougher UP students" who have survived inside and been able to find the way out in the right time. 

The greatest way of thanking and paying the university is proving that you deserve the title of being a UP graduate.

Narinig ko usapan ng ilan sa mga grumaduate:

UP1: Pasaway ka! Tignan mo sa row natin ikaw lang ang iba ang kulay ng dress.
UP2: Ok lang, atleast nagstand-out ako.
UP1: Kahit na, pasaway ka pa rin. Baka pagalitan ka nyan.
UP2: Nasa UP tayo. May freedom of expression. Pasaway man ako, atleast masaya ako sa araw na to. Can express myself and how i truly feel for this big day through my dress and been able to stand-out in a row. 
UP1: Ah, ok.

Nakakatuwa sila. Ang sarap pakinggan yung sinabi nyang, "atleast nagstand-out ako."

Monday. Boss. Fresh from Baguio. Nagkwento tungkol sa graduation ng anak nya. At natuwa daw sya sa mga narinig nyang speeches.

Boss: Why have you chosen to work here instead of getting a better and higher paid job abroad?
Blue: Can't afford to leave my family.
Green: I can't afford that too. And besides, we need company l...oyalty.
Yellow: I got a stable job here. I won't take the risk of losing it.
Maroon: I don't know if you guys can understand this but there's something that really holds me stay here.
Blue: What?
Boss: hmmm.. I tried working abroad but after a couple of years, I decided to fly back and stay here for good.
Maroon: It's more satisfying and fulfilling to stay, work and serve this country.
Boss: Agree! the same thing I felt before. (starts singing) "...malayong lupain amin mang marating di rin magbabago ang damdamin..."

We plan to print these quotes on various clothing and accessories. In

the best quotes from University of the Philippineﾒs Overheard page.

April 26, 2010

 Dear Mr. Rillera,

Good day!

We are
Aileen Choa-Yu, Sydney Dondon, Giesille Go, Jillian Ng, Marvie
Santioque and Leia Veracruz, a group of junior, BS Management students
in Ateneo de Manila University. 

As part of the Operations
Management course we are currently taking up under Mr. Michael C. Tan,
we are required to develop a business plan for a new product or service
and realize this idea into a final paper. Our group plans to gather the
best quotes from the Overheard Facebook accounts of the following
universities: the University of the Philippines, Ateneo de Manila
University, De La Salle University, and the University of Sto. Thomas.

Part 1 of 2

Overheard from FilOil Flying V Arena last month, or actually overlooked from another side of the bleachers. During Game 2 of the PBL-PG Flex-Erase Placenta Unity Cup Finals between the UP Fighting Maroons (Pharex) and the San Sebastian Golden Stags (Excelroof), some Excelroof fans, perhaps its employees, went wild and unruly when the Stags made the game-deciding scoring spree. One undressed himself while celebrating (Soccer game ba pinanood ko noon? Di ba basketball?) and his comrades even did the death gesture to the UP Pep Squad. With the majority of the Pharex supporters being UP students/alumni including me, we really got pissed off with their behavior.

math 100 2nd sem 4th exam mahirap yung exam tapos yung isang clasm8 nagtaas ng kamay (non-verbatim):

clasm8: sir pwede po magtanong?
prof: sige pero minus 1 per question.
clasm8: pag iisipan ko po.

ayun. kahit ako napaisip na din magtanong. wala na din ako masagot eh. might as well magtanong na ko mamaya me bigla pang pumasok sa utak ko. si kuya clasm8 naman go na, nagtanong na kay sir.

clasm8: sige sir payag na ko.
prof: sige. (lumabas sila pareho)

after several minutes...

clasm8: waah!! wala din ako nakuha sa tinanong ko! 2 pts pa naman un!!

sayang ang 2 points :) ung isang ate clasm8 nagtanong kung ipapasa daw ba ung questionnaire tas sabi ni sir minus 1 na daw yun kasi nagtanong siya :) pero syempre joke lang un :)

2nd exam sa isang major subject nun. Napakahirap. Habang nag-eexam, nagbubulungan kami ng seat mate ko.

Me: Kamusta ka naman?
Seatmate: Wala na akong maisagot.
Me: Ako man e.
Seatmate: Kelangan maipasa ko 'to. Wait, may itatanong lang ako kay sir (raises hand). Sir, pwede magtanong?
Sir: What's your question?
Seatmate: Ano po paboritong ulam nyo?
Sir: (raises eyebrow) What?
Seatmate: Ipagluluto ko po kayo, ipasa nyo lang po ako.

Hahahahaha. Desperado. Kaya siguro sya bumagsak sa exam na yun :D

2006 Freshies kami, uso pa nun ang "Flat Rate" - 80pesos for 6hrs yata, limot ko na.

Almost every night nun naglalaro kami sa Grove, overnight. Naglalaro kaming magruroommates sa Barracks non nung grand entry ng Milenyo sa LB. Hindi pa sana kami tatayo, tapos nag-brownout, napilitan na kaming umalis. Sobrang dalang ng jip na umaakyat non, malakas na hangin, may mga natumbang puno na sa LB Square.

Ayon, paggising namen nung tanghalian nun parang dagat na yung Soccer Field at walang bumabyaheng jip. At natumba yung malaking puno malapit sa admin. Masaya yung mga araw na yon. :D

I answered na gusto ko magpolitical science then laws and specified the school na definitely ay di UP. She quizzed me na "alam mo bang dalawa lamang schools sa Pilipinas?" Siya na rin sumagot tanong niya. Its " UP and OTHERS."

When I entered the voting area in my precinct [376, Bahay Toro (Project 8), Quezon City, Metro Manila], I just found out that my first grade was an assigned election inspector there. When they were confirming my identity, she did not recognize me. That was early in the morning. By nighttime, during the canvassing, she got to recognize me while counter checking the people who actually voted. When we reminisced 1995, I cited Andrew Guinto as one of my classmates that time. She told me that he entered Philippine Science High School.
Me: Saan po siya (Andrew) nag-college
Mrs. Luz Guzman (My 1st grade teacher): Sa Pisay nga.
Me uli: Doon siya ngayon nagtuturo?
Si Ma'am Luz uli: Doon siya nag-aaral. (I got confused.)
When I went back to LB, I am still confused and laughing while remembering that.
Hanggang ngayon, high school pa rin siya? watda... Paging Andrew Guinto or anyone who knows him.

A simple math to see how Manny Villar is really 
corrupt (naisip ko lang). Noynoy Aquino says, "kung walang corrupt, 
walang mahirap." So walang corrupt = walang mahirap. But mahirap = Manny
 Villar. So, substituting mahirap with Manny Villar, we get walang 
corrupt = walang (Manny Villar). Cancel "walang" from both sides ...of 
the equation, and we get [corrupt = Manny Villar]. *wala pong asaran*

Reminiscing early college life. UPLB, Men's Dorm, Christmas Party 2005. Si Eddie Si Jezreel Pattaguan (Jeng) ay isa sa mga emcee ng program (Wing Rep e). Nagpapa-trivia noon para mamigay ng prizes.

Aries to Jeng: Itanong mo to. "Ano ang pretzel capital of the world?"
Jeng: Anong sagot?
Aries: Swaziland
Jeng: Ok. Ok.
Jeng to crowd: O eto. Isa pang tanong para sa isa uling prize. Ano ang capital ng Swaziland?

Tapos may biglang sumigaw sa audience.
A: Mbabane!
Jeng: Mali! O, wala nang iba? Ang tamang sagot ay PRETZEL!!!
Kami: *tumbling sa tawa*
Pagbalik sa room after ng party, tiningnan ang Almanac. Mbabane pala talaga ang capital ng Swaziland. Hahahaha!

kuyang pamangkin ni justice secretary corona: ang problema sa pilipinas ay edukasyon, out of 100 students only 44 finish highschool at di pa lahat magagaling ung iba dian, pasang-awa lang, galing ako sa science highschool tapos malapit samin yung national high school tapos ung mga tao dun, nagbibisyo, mga siga etc.

ateng galing national highschool: galing ako sa national highschool, sana wag ka mag generalize di naman lahat kami barumbado, ung iba nga sa catholic school pa nagaaral tapos nagbibisyo din, nakikipag-away din.

kuyang galing sa catholic school: galing po ako ng catholic school, kung ayaw mong mageneralize, wag ka din mag generalize.

MY TIP #002: The PhP10 Supper/Meal

This used to be the P5 meal but I will adjust kasi inflated na ngayon.

1. Bili ka ng 2 isaw (P2/each, sa may Law na ngayon at ung sa harap ng kalay). Dagdagan mo ng suka kasi sabaw na rin un.

2. Bili ng 2 kanin (P3/each, aristocart, location: Eng'g/educ; sa may malapit sa lutong bahay)

NOTE:
1. Yes, dapat willing kang maglakad. Kung mahirap kang katulad ko noon, lalakarin mo talaga yan.
2. Di ko sigurado kung nandyan pa ung aristoCART.

MY TIP #001: Joining a student organization (org)

When reciting the preamble of the constitution of an organization, remember that you are NOT a member yet. Hence, you have no right to say, "We... ". 

What you must do is say something like, "I quote... "We" "

This will save you from shedding some tears. Marami na akong nagago dahil dito. hehe

You may not be her first, her last, or her only. She loved before she 
may love again. But if she loves you now, what else matters? She's not 
perfect - you aren't either, and the two of you may never be perfect 
together but if she can make you laugh, cause you to think twice, and 
admit to being human and making mistakes, HOLD ONTO HER and give her the
 most you can. She may not be thinking about you every second of the 
day, but she will give you a part of her that she knows you can 
break--her heart. So DON"T YOU HURT HER, don't change her, don't analyze
 and don't expect more than she can give. Smile when she makes you 
happy, let her know when she makes you mad, and miss her when she's not 
there. 

-Bob Marley

Suppose you had a birthday party. You decided to invite the following people:

- your best friend
- a humble Atenean
- an intelligent La Sallite
- a UP student who graduated on time
- Batman and Robin
- Darna

Suddenly, the lights go out and when it goes on again, your cake is gone. 
The million-dollar question is:
Who took your cake?

Answer:
Your best friend. All the other guests are merely figments of your imagination.

Kaninang hapon sa isang klase ng Math 101: Logic and Set Theory
Kwento ni Prof.

Nagkaroon ng summer camp for mathematics teachers in colleges located in the CALABARZON area na in-offer ng IMSP.
May discussion tungkol sa tamang pagturo ng Methods of Proof sa mga estudyante. Ang siste, hinati ang mga nagseseminar sa ilang mga grupo.
Tapos, magpepresent sila.
May isang nagpresent.
Para daw maituro ang direct proof, diretso lang sa proof.
'Pag indirect proof naman daw, magkukwento muna ng kung anu-ano sa mga estudyante, magpapaliguy-ligoy, tsaka ipoprove.

Sa mga naka-gets..
INDIRECT proof nga naman.
:))

Sa class ng Math 101 - Logic and Set Theory [UPLB]:
Predicate Calculus ang topic:

P(x): x will pass Math 101.
M(x): x will get 1.0 in Math 101.
A is the set of students enrolled in Math 101 F.

[In symbols 'yung pagkakalagay] 
All students will pass Math 101. (For all x in A, P(x))
There exist a student who will get 1.0 in Math 101. (There exist an x in A, M(x))

Prof: So far, sa na-handle-an kong Math 101, 'yung negation ang totoo.
[In symbols 'yung pagkakalagay] 
Negation:
There exist a student who will not pass Math 101. (There exist an x in A, ~P(x))
All students will not get 1.0 in Math 101. (For all x in A, ~M(x))

:))
Na-pressure naman daw kami. XD

Prof: Okay class, can you give me some characteristics of an animal?

Prof: Very good! Another one! Yes, Ms. *insert name*

Prof: Wonderful. Yes, Miss *insert name*, can you add more?

RTR ng College SC tungkol sa systemwide mass walkout

Rep: Systemwide ang Walkout. At exactly 9 AM, lahat ng estudyante ng U.P., mapa-anong campus pa man iyan, ay sabay sabay na lalabas upang tutulan ang pagtaas ng tuition.

Freshie: Ano naman ang mapapala namin sa walkout na iyan? aabsent lang kami sa klase. Sayang lang yung pinambabayad namin dito.

Rep: Eh alam mo namang ganito ang siste dito sa U.P. eh. Kaya nga tayo naging "Iskolar ng Bayan" eh. Kung makasarili lagi iyang pag-iisip mo, hindi ka bagay dito.

i read the very controversial "Vinceton Blog". actually, in my opinion, it's nice that someone posted it here, in our group, since it concerns us UP students/alumni (alumna na kasi ako..hehe), not to mention it's a good topic for intellectual masturbation.

siguro,the problem here is in how we present/explain our arguments. napansin ko kasi sa mga comments sa blog na parang irrational na siya at illogical. parang yung mga atake kasi ng arguments eh sa tao na hindi na dun sa mismong premise. according to my philo1 class it's a fallacy na called argumentum ad hominem (sa pagkakatanda ko). siguro, mas maganda sana kung yung mismong topic yung i-rebut natin, hindi yung sa karakter ng nagpost. taga-UP tayo,ipakita natin na mga rasyonal tayong tao na kayang idefend ang ating opinyon sa maayos na paraan.

para na din sa lahat, please refrain from giving insulting remarks, dun kasi nagsisimula yung gulo.

^___^

Ailene Florece and I were rushing to meet her friend at NBS SM North. We were ambushed by a promo guy who said they were giving free pillows to those who would answer a yes or no survey question. When we were claiming such pillows, I saw that the company was the infamous Philippine Prudential Life.

I wanted to be polite so I backed out gently, giving vague excuses. And then he asked me, UP ka no? A quick yes and then he gave me to his manager, a less likable woman. She still tried to convince me so I started badgering her about another friend's traumatic encounter with their company, how the machines were pre-programmed for you to win then you would be psychologically coerced to avail of an insurance plan, etc.

The mgr couldn't look me in the eye anymore, and another lady seemed to come to the rescue and asked, "OK na ba? OK na ba?" The mgr looked at her and said, "UP s'ya eh... (pointing to me) UP din s'ya... (pointing to Ailene)"

'Nuff said! They dispersed like magic!

Tips sa pagpili ng password: Dapat mahirap mahulaan ng iba pero madali nyong matandaan. Halimbawa: may kakilala ako na kapag nag pa password ay madali lang. Yung mga ginagamit nyang password ay mga words gaya ng "destiny", "happy", "peace".Wag tularan. Ako pag pumipili ng password sentence ang ginagamit ko. Example: the sentence is "There are infinitely many lines passing through a given point. " kaya ang password ko ay " tr8mlptag. " pero pinalitan ko na...sentence uli sya para mahirap mahulaan.

haay, everyone seems to be talking about how well their sembreaks are going. well, mine hasn't even started yet. last exam: oct 28.

Mga depinisyon ko ng SEM BREAK:


- nagsem break din ang allowance

- panahon kung kailan pwede akong matulog ng maaga pero nagpupuyat pa rin (movie marathon and the likes)

- panahon kung kailan best friend na kami ulit ng higaan 

- pakikipagbuno sa CRS; iienlist ang mga kailangan at gusto hanggang mamula ang account ko dahil sa conflict ang mga sked

- umaasam na magkaPE, MST, at PI 100

- nagluluksa o nagsasaya sa mga markang nakuha sa katatapos na sem

- at higit sa lahat, alam ko na ulit kung ano ang almusal, tanghalian, at hapunan


HAPPY SEMBREAK!

dahil freshman at excited sa experience bilang isang kolehiyala, i left the boarding house 2 1/2 hours before my class.. sumakay ng ikot (as per my landlady's instructions para makarating ng new CAL building for my French 10 class) got to my class 10 mins late because i got lost and kinailangan kong lakarin mula admissions (kung san ako bumaba)walked behind Quezon hall, reached Univ Theater and walked back when i realized i was going the wrong way (ayun sa mapa na hawak ko galing sa freshman kit na hirap na hirap akong itago), umaktay ng CAL 5th floor (na naConfirm kong CAL nga, salamat sa nasalubong kong boardmate)and had to wait 45 mins just to be advised na wala pa ang prof.. after ng araw na yun, one of my boardmates and i, had to trace ang route ng Ikot at Toki, which we wrote sa isang maliit na card. what a way to remember my freshman year. hahaha

Medical Entomology class
(non-verbatim)

Prof: Ok, so we won't be having a lab session today
Class: (cheered) YES!
Prof: O_O what is it you don't like about your lab?
Class: Drawing the specimens!
Prof: You know what, we don't make you just label the parts of the specimen like they do in other schools because you're in UP. You need to exert more effort than that, you need to have extra values added. If you're not up to it, don't study in UP.

Father Thor: bakit ka umiiyak neng?

I remember a prof back in UP clark. For class monitoring, she would ask us to write contact info sa 1/8th index card. Andun ang name, address, mobile number and all. Pero ang twist, ipapalagay nya yung grade "that you would like to get by the end of the sem" at yung grade "that you are willing to work for." Pag may nagrereact na pareho lang yun, sinasabi niya, "Magkaiba yun. Iba ang WISH sa GOAL." 4 times ko syang naprof at tlgng dun lang ako sa level ng goal. ang wish ko, wish ko lang tlg..

Mga Isko at Iska, Mining is an art and science, hindi ito isang larangang ginagawa ng walang sistema, hindi porke may deposit ka sa isang probinsya, eh miminahin mo na ang buong probinsiya, ang lahat ng industriya ay konektado sa minahan at alam nating napakahalaga ng pagmimina, kelangan lang natin isagawa ang Responsible Mining upang magkaroon ng balanse ang kaunlaran at kalikasan. Magtulungan po tayong ikalat ang wastong kaalaman tungkol sa Responisble Mining.

Para lang po sa kaalaman ng lahat, ang UP Diliman ay nag-ooffer ng kursong Mining Engineering kung saan itinuturo ang responsibilidad sa mga IP's at ang rehabilitation sa tapos na o kasalukuyan pang miniminang lokasyon. Kasama rin dito ang mga batas na may kinalaman sa pagmimina.

Sa dining table, meron kaming seating arrangement: yung conventional na arrangement according to age and or power. Umupo ang younger brother ko sa pwesto ko and I reacted, "Why are you there? Are you there?" Literal na tinagalog na "Bakit ka nandyan? Dyan ka ba?" At nagreact ang kapatid ko, "Ayos sa English ah? Taga-UP yan!" Not giving up on the issue, I said, "Why are you on my seat? Is that your rightful place!?" Tumayo siya agad at sabi, "Tang-ina, tatabi na ako. Taga-UP nga ito! Woooh! (sabay palakpak)"
